alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 7:25PM EDT until June 29 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Greenville and Elliotsville Road in Monson are closed due to flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. A Flash Flood Warning is also in effect for portions of Piscataquis County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Greenville, Guilford, Monson, Blanchard, Elliottsville, Kingsbury Plantation, Sangerville, Parkman, Abbot, Wellington, Shirley, Willimantic, Bowerbank, Kingsbury, Onawa, Barnard and Katahdin Iron Works. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
